@sp11k3t3ht3rd wrote:

To start this, I haven’t given up on my other project, this is just a fun little side thing. Well my VHS class(Virtual High School) ended before winter break so now I sit in the library and screw off on the computers. I installed the jdk to my account and decided I’d do some programming. I came up with this idea, expanding on the avoid the square game. My friend came up with the name. It’s an inside joke about how when you touch all your fingertips together and shake your hand (bad description) its a “bouquet” of the middle finger. You control a black square that can shoot bullets. There are multiple flowers that chase you around the screen. If one touches you, you loose. You can shoot the flowers to keep them away though. It’s still in development so there are still bugs, but here is a video shot on my iTouch of it (Before implementation of certain concepts):

[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tMByTgLRhZI[/youtube]

UPDATED

Game.java

[code=java5]import java.awt.;
import java.awt.event.;
import javax.swing.*;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.awt.Rectangle;

public class Game implements ActionListener {

JFrame frame;
DP panel;
KL keyListener;
static ArrayList <Bullet> bullets = new ArrayList<Bullet>();
static ArrayList <Flower> enemies = new ArrayList<Flower>();
Player player;

Timer time;
String dir;
int rand;
int randEnemy;
int randX;
int randY;
int randType;
static int score = 0;

public Game() {

	frame = new JFrame("The Bouquet");
	panel = new DP(true);
	keyListener = new KL();
	player = new Player(0,0,50,50);

	time = new Timer(5, this);
	time.start();

}

public static void main(String[] args) {

	Game game = new Game();
	game.setUp();

}

public void setUp() {

	frame.setSize(800, 640);
	frame.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);

	panel.addKeyListener(keyListener);
	panel.setFocusable(true);

	frame.getContentPane().add(BorderLayout.CENTER, panel);
	frame.setVisible(true);

}

public static void removeEnemy(Flower f) {

	if(enemies.size() > 0) {

		enemies.remove(f);

	}

}


public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {

	randEnemy = (int) (Math.random() * 1000);
	randType = (int) (Math.random() * 4) + 1;

	if (randEnemy <= 2) {

		randX = (int) (Math.random() * 800);
		randY = (int) (Math.random() * 640);

		enemies.add(new Flower(randType, randX, randY));

	}

	player.move();

	if(bullets.size() > 0) {

		for(int i = 0; i < bullets.size(); i++) {

			bullets.get(i).move();

		}

	}

	Rectangle test = new Rectangle((int)player.getX(),(int)player.getY(),50,50);


	for(int i = 0; i < enemies.size(); i++) {


		if(enemies.size() > 0) {

			enemies.get(i).move((int) player.getX(),(int) player.getY());

		}

		for(int j = 0; j < bullets.size(); j++) {

			if(enemies.size() > 0) {

				enemies.get(i).testCollision(bullets.get(j), "bullet");

			}

		}

		if(enemies.size() > 0) {

			enemies.get(i).testCollision(test, "player");

		}

	}

	frame.repaint();

}


public class DP extends JPanel {


	public DP(boolean buff) {

		this.setDoubleBuffered(buff);

	}

	public void paintComponent(Graphics g) {

		int r = (int) (Math.random() * 256);
		int gr = (int) (Math.random() * 256);
		int b = (int) (Math.random() * 256);

		g.setColor(new Color(r,gr,b));
		g.fillRect(0, 0, this.getWidth(), this.getHeight());

		g.setColor(Color.BLACK);
		g.fillRect((int) player.getX(), (int) player.getY(), 50, 50);

		String coords = "COORDS: (" + (int) player.getX() + "," + (int) player.getY() + ")";
		g.drawString(coords, 0, 10);
		g.drawString("Enemies: " + Integer.toString(enemies.size()), 0, 20);
		g.drawString("Bullets: " + Integer.toString(bullets.size()), 0, 30);
		g.drawString("SCORE: " + Integer.toString(score), 0, 40);

		if(bullets.size() > 0) {

			g.setColor(Color.WHITE);

			for (int i = 0; i < bullets.size(); i ++) {

				g.fillRect((int) bullets.get(i).getX(), (int) bullets.get(i).getY(), (int) bullets.get(i).getWidth(), (int) bullets.get(i).getHeight());

			}

		}

		if(enemies.size() > 0) {

			for(int i = 0; i < enemies.size(); i++) {

				g.drawImage(enemies.get(i).getImage(), enemies.get(i).getX(), enemies.get(i).getY(), 25, 25, null);

			}

		}

		if(enemies.size() > 0) {

			for(int i = 0; i < enemies.size(); i++) {

				if(enemies.get(i).getGameOver()) {

					if(enemies.get(i).getGameOver()) {

						g.drawString("GAME OVER!!!", 400, 320);

					}

					g.drawString("GAME OVER!!!", 400, 320);
					try { Thread.sleep(5000);}catch(Exception e) {e.printStackTrace();}
					System.exit(0);

				}

			}

		}

	}

}

public class KL extends KeyAdapter {

	public void keyPressed(KeyEvent e) {
		
		player.keyPressed(e);

	}

	public void keyReleased(KeyEvent e) {

		player.keyReleased(e);

	}

}

}
[/code]

Player.java

[code=java5]import java.awt.Rectangle;
import java.awt.event.*;

public class Player extends Rectangle {

int dx, dy;
String dir;

public Player(int x, int y, int width, int height) {

	this.x = x;
	this.y = y;
	this.width = width;
	this.height = height;

	dir = "left";

}

public void move() {

	x += dx;
	y += dy;

}

public void keyPressed(KeyEvent e) {

	int key = e.getKeyCode();

	switch(key) {

		case KeyEvent.VK_UP:
			dy = -3;
			dir = "up";
			break;
		case KeyEvent.VK_DOWN:
			dy = 3;
			dir = "down";
			break;
		case KeyEvent.VK_RIGHT:
			dx = 3;
			dir = "right";
			break;
		case KeyEvent.VK_LEFT:
			dx = -3;
			dir = "left";
			break;
		case KeyEvent.VK_SPACE:
			Game.bullets.add(new Bullet(x, y, 10, 5, dir));
			break;

	}

}

public void keyReleased(KeyEvent e) {

	int key = e.getKeyCode();

	switch(key) {

		case KeyEvent.VK_UP:
			dy = 0;
			break;

		case KeyEvent.VK_DOWN:
			dy = 0;
			break;
		case KeyEvent.VK_RIGHT:
			dx = 0;
			break;
		case KeyEvent.VK_LEFT:
			dx = 0;
			break;

	}

}

}[/code]

Bullet.java

[code=java5]import java.awt.Rectangle;

public class Bullet extends Rectangle {

int dy,dx;

String dir;

public Bullet(int x, int y, int width, int height, String lastDir) {

	this.x = x;
	this.y = y;
	this.width = width;
	this.height = height;

	dir = lastDir;

}

public void move() {

	if (dir.equalsIgnoreCase("up")) {

		dy = -10;
		y += dy;

	} else if (dir.equalsIgnoreCase("down")) {

		dy = 10;
		y += dy;

	} else if (dir.equalsIgnoreCase("left")) {

		dx = -10;
		x += dx;

	} else if (dir.equalsIgnoreCase("right")) {

		dx = 10;
		x += dx;

	}


}

}[/code]

Flower.java

[code=java5]import java.awt.Image;
import javax.swing.ImageIcon;
import java.awt.Rectangle;

public class Flower {

static Image img;
static Image blue;
static Image black;
static Image orange;
static Image purple;
static Image red;

int x, y, dx, dy;
boolean gameOver = false;

public Flower(int type, int x, int y) {

	blue = new ImageIcon("H:/Programming/Game/blue.png").getImage();
	black = new ImageIcon("H:/Programming/Game/black.png").getImage();
	orange = new ImageIcon("H:/Programming/Game/orange.png").getImage();
	purple = new ImageIcon("H:/Programming/Game/purple.png").getImage();
	red = new ImageIcon("H:/Programming/Game/red.png").getImage();

	switch(type) {

		case 1:
			img = blue;
			break;
		case 2:
			img = black;
			break;
		case 3:
			img = orange;
			break;
		case 4:
			img = purple;
			break;
		case 5:
			img = red;
			break;

	}

	this.x = x;
	this.y = y;


}

public Image getImage() {

	return img;

}

public void move(int x, int y) {

	if(x > this.x) {

		dx = 1;

	} else {

		dx = -1;

	}

	if(y > this.y) {

		dy = 1;

	} else {

		dy = -1;

	}

	this.x += dx;
	this.y += dy;

}

public int getX() {

	return x;

}

public int getY() {

	return y;

}

public void testCollision(Rectangle r, String type) {

	Rectangle test = new Rectangle(x,y,25,25);

	if(r.intersects(test) && (type.equals("bullet"))) {

		Game.removeEnemy(this);
		Game.score += 10;

	}

	if(r.intersects(test) && (type.equals("player"))) {


		gameOver = true;

	}		

}

public boolean getGameOver() {

	return gameOver;

}

}[/code]
